In the context of the game you're describing, the standard solution to this type of game is known as the Nash Bargaining Solution. This solution involves calculating the bargaining power of both players based on their minimum acceptable offer, and then finding a proposal that maximizes the joint payoff while satisfying these minimum acceptable offers. 

Assuming that the Proposer proposes a fair and mutually beneficial split, meaning that the proposed offer isn't ridiculously unfair to the Responder, the standard solution implies that the minimal amount the Responder should accept is `50%`, which corresponds to [$50].
